newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Hewlett-Packard falls.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Hewlett-Packard falls.

text.p: Shares of Hewlett-Packard Co fell in pre-opening trade Monday in a reaction to third-quarter results that fell short of expectations.
Traders reported light activity as investors remained wary following Friday's 247-point fall in the Dow industrials.
"I think people are cautious going into the opening," one trader said. "People are just not pulling the trigger as fast."
Hewlett-Packard was trading at 64-5/16, rebounding from a drop that took it as low as 62. It closed Friday at 66-3/16.
The computer products company reported third-quarter earnings of $0.58 a share, versus $0.40 for the same period last year. The results fell short of a First Call consensus estimate of $0.68 a share.

Among other shares, semiconductor maker Intel Corp was trading at 91-7/8, down from a Friday close at 92-2/16, and International Business Machines Corp eased to 99-1/4 from a Friday close of 99-15/16.
